snippet: Hamas said it suspended the elections commission for not treating its supporters in the West Bank fairly, halting one of the only tangible steps toward reconciliation with the rival Fatah Party based in the West Bank.
abstract: Hamas-run government in Gaza suspends the work of the Palestinian Central Elections Commission a day before it was to start registering new voters, abruptly halting one of the few tangible steps toward reconciliation with the rival Fatah party, based in the West Bank; the move pushes off the prospect of presidential and parliamentary elections.

byline.original: By FARES AKRAM and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Fares Akram reported from Gaza, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem. Khaled Abu Aker contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: Hamas said it suspended the elections commission for not treating its supporters in the West Bank fairly, halting one of the only tangible steps toward reconciliation with the rival Fatah Party based in the West Bank.

headline.seo: Hamas Suspends Voter Registration in Gaza
headline.main: Hamas Suspends Voter Registration Process in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Hamas Suspends Voter Registration Process in Gaza
